page.title: 12QUARRYING IN MOUNTSORREL
page.content: { Mountsorrel Quarry,or Buddon Wood}as it is known has been in existence since 1828,and a{Roman bucket}has been found on the site.The material worked is{granite.It produces two and a half {million tons of hard-rock granite {chippings for the construction {industry,especially the building of {motorways.It is the largest quarry of {its kind in Europe.}It was the first place to make tar-coated granite long before MacAdam.It is excavated by drilling holes then putting explosives down the hole and blasting it out.It is then loaded into 85-ton dumper trucks using mechanical excavators mounted on tracks.A large crusher reduces the shotrock to <8ins100 men are employed. A NEW TAR-MAKING PROJECT is causing some poeple concern,but typifies the policy of progress ensuring employment and fame.
